meanings.definition: In a way that is clear and not open to more than one interpretation.
meanings.sent1: She unambiguously stated her opinion on the matter.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were unambiguously written on the board.
meanings.sent3: He unambiguously declared himself the king of the playground.
meanings.sent4: The truth shone unambiguously through her words.
meanings.sent5: The answer was unambiguously revealed in the final chapter.

meanings.definition: In a way that leaves no doubt or uncertainty.
meanings.sent1: The results unambiguously showed the effectiveness of the new treatment.
meanings.sent2: She unambiguously confirmed her attendance at the event.
meanings.sent3: The cat unambiguously claimed the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: His smile unambiguously conveyed his happiness.
meanings.sent5: The stars unambiguously lit up the night sky.
